{"step_by_step_thinking": "The thermic effect of food is the energy required for digestion, absorption, and disposal of ingested nutrients. According to Document [2], the thermic effect of food varies depending on the composition of the food consumed. The document states that the thermic effect of protein is 20 to 30%, which is higher than that of carbohydrates (5 to 15%) and fats (at most 5 to 15%). Therefore, the maximum thermic effect of food is seen with protein.", "answer_choice": "B. Protein"}
